habitat_description:
Native to the Four Corners area of Utah, Colorado, Arizona and New Mexico. It was introduced to Oregon and now can be found in Cove Palisades State Park, Jefferson County (Storm and Leonard 1995). In Arizona, it can be found in Plains and Great Basin Grassland, Great Basin Conifer Woodland, and Petran Montane Conifer Forest (Brennan and Holycross 2009). Distribution of this lizard is confined to the proximity of the Colorado Plateau in northern Arizona and New Mexico, Utah, central to southwestern Colorado. This species can be found in chaparral, pinon/juniper woodland, Ponderosa Pine Forest, grassland, and Great Basin desert scrub (Jones and Lovich 2009).

Lowland riparian zones and shrubland/chaparral, conifer woodland, hardwood woodland. Pinion/juniper forests, mountainous shrubland, open chaparral, oak woodland, and up tp the lower elevation areas of the ponderosa pine and Douglas/fir forests.
